results.title: Thumpalong
results.creator_credit: Peter Nicholson, Australian Film Commission and Peter Nicholson Productions
results.brief_description: Using vibrant colours, this hand drawn animated film by Peter Nicholson tells the story about an old king who hates music, and a wonderous character called Thumpalong, who is an amazing “One Man Band”.

results.title: The Catalysts
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions

results.title: Seed dispersal. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a visual report on different types of seedcoats and shows how external agents such as man,the wind, animals and birds help each kind become dispersed. Depending on which season it is, this will influence the dispersal of each type of seed.

results.title: Tin miners of Malaysia
results.brief_description:
Examines Kinta Valley area in the Malaysian mountains which contains the world’s largest tin deposit. Follows a 16 year old boy and his family to show lifestyles of Malaysian miners and to increase the understanding of a country whose people are of many races and national origins.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Discovering American folk music
results.creator_credit: Bernard Wilets and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: Reviews two main influences on the development of American folk music. Traces the history of one ballad from its original British version to its emergence in the West as the cowboy song, “Streets of Laredo”, and later in an African American blues version, “The St James Infirmary”.

results.title: First days of life
results.creator_credit: Claude Edelmann, Boulton-Hawker Films and Les Films du Levant
results.brief_description: Shows the sequence of a natural childbirth, reviews all facets of the developing foetus and depicts some aspects of the development of the child to the age of three. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Buns
results.creator_credit: Thomas Bammel, Depicture Company and Oxford Films (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Shows a large factory complete with automation and assembly line, producing hamburger buns. Covers each detail of this production from the giant kneader handling hundreds of pounds of dough to the automatic packaging and shipping. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
